titleStmt.title: Charles D. Pennebaker to Daniel W. Lindsey
CWG12163

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p: dinit but I suppose I have no right to do so, as he declined to answer a formal request for his opinion on matters touching the duties of this office --

I am Sir respectfully
Your obit Sert
C D Pennebaker
Agt State of Ky

Genl D W Lindsay
Frankfort Ky
vol, 13 -- 214 & 15

18
Office Ky State Agency
Washington D C
April 17th 1866
Pennebaker C. D
State Agent.

Says the claim of Eliza J Race widow of Wm T Race late a private of Co "D". 18th Ky Inf for widows pension has been suspended upon the grounds she had a husband living at the time she married Race. She says under oath she had not heard from her first husband but once in seven years, and there from his sister that he was dead. Desires you to get the Atty Genl opinion as to the lex loci on the subject of her right to marry again in the premises.

L. B. No 20 -- 1866 P 178
Recd A G O Ky 23d April 1866
The legal advice and opinion of the Atty Genl of Ky is requested -- for the guidance of the officer in this case.
